intro: Trachelospermum lucidum, commonly known as the star jasmine, is a climbing vine native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. The plant has opposite, simple, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Trachelospermum lucidum is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and its ability to cover trellises or walls.
